intro: Echinospermum marginatum, commonly known as the margined echinoseed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its fruit is a dry, hairy capsule that contains several seeds, typical of the Asteraceae family. Echinospermum marginatum is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
